episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics, including the use of 3D glasses in heart surgery, the potential future of pigeon milk as a health supplement, historical book storage practices, and a humorous mishap involving an Egyptian government memo. The hosts delve into these facts with their usual blend of humor and insight, providing listeners with both entertainment and education.

facts.fact: Heart surgeons now perform surgery while wearing 3D glasses.
One day we may all be drinking pigeon milk.
Books used to be stacked with the spines facing inwards.
In May, an internal memo by the Egyptian government on how to crush the press was accidentally sent out to the press.
